glosses: Uppsala (a city in eastern central Sweden)
categories: Finnish terms derived from Old Norse

words.etymology_text: Borrowed from Swedish Uppsala, from Old Norse Uppsalir (literally “upper halls, upper dwellings”).

etymology_templates.name: der
etymology_templates.expansion: Old Norse Uppsalir (literally “upper halls, upper dwellings”)

words.etymology_text: From Proto-Finnic *upeda, probably borrowed from Proto-Germanic [Term?] (compare German üppig).

glosses: first-person singular present indicative of upottaa
instructive of second active infinitive of upottaa

examples.text: Kirkko joutui upoksiin, kun tekoallas rakennettiin.
examples.english: The church was left under the water when the reservoir was built.

glosses: sunken, submerged, under water (to the state of being under water or other liquid)

words.etymology_text: The illative plural of uppo with the interfix -ksi-.

examples.text: Varastettu vene löytyi upoksista Kulosaaren edustalta.
examples.english: The stolen boat was found submerged in the waters of Kulosaari.

glosses: from below the surface, from the depths, submerged (from the state of being under water or other liquid to the surface)

words.etymology_text: upotus (“immersion”) + suolaus (“salting”) or upotussuolata (“to salt in brine”) + -us (“-ing”)

words.etymology_text: From uusi through the reduplication of the initial sounds, compare täpötäysi, typötyhjä, ypöyksin, apposen auki.
